data.text:
What does it take to work for the UN in some of the world’s most challenging places?

In our podcast 'Awake At Night', UN Global Communications chief @MelissaFleming speaks with some of our extraordinary staff members to find out. 

Take a listen: 🎧 https://t.co/4C9nNQISfZ https://t.co/t8JnfkdDI9

Education is a human right, not a privilege.

Join @UNESCO & #StandUp4HumanRights to ensure everyone, everywhere can access quality education. https://t.co/pKrL6QJvDV https://t.co/CFWFJyyOXC

As cold weather sets in, displaced families across Afghanistan are among the most vulnerable to the dangers of winter.

@IOMAfghanistan has expanded its humanitarian response to provide emergency kits to those in need. https://t.co/adlvSEodk3 https://t.co/Y0QsAERE7I

Everyone has the right to a nationality.

Yet, millions around the world have been denied their right to a nationality, preventing them from going to school, seeing a doctor, getting a job or even getting married.

See how @Refugees is helping: https://t.co/ABRn5GFjuD https://t.co/f5pgjQTYhN

1 million plastic bottles are sold around the world per minute, adding to the plastic pollution that ends up in our landfills and oceans. 

We can all make a difference if we simply bring our own refillable bottle. 

Get more #ClimateAction tips here ➡ https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/BoAvCt9FiJ

In 2022, 274 million people around the world will need humanitarian assistance.

The Global Humanitarian Overview highlights the urgent need to #InvestInHumanity.

More from @UNOCHA: https://t.co/3bX57o9gE1 #GHO2022 https://t.co/jypywdoyW8

Decent working & living conditions are essential for small-scale fishers, fish farmers & fish workers. 🐟🐠

2022 is the International Year of Artisanal Fisheries & Aquaculture. 
https://t.co/fwsogiHGfn #IYAFA2022 via @FAO https://t.co/ZL9yTLULtC

The Trolls are doing their part to protect our planet & they are asking YOU to become a food hero like them.

🍊🌽🫐🥕🍌🥦

From buying local & seasonal fruits & vegetables to wasting less food, all of us can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #TrollsFoodHeroes https://t.co/IbaRj24TCL

Norway assumes the rotating presidency of the Security Council for the month of January.

Follow @NorwayUN for updates. https://t.co/nIsXVJw96D https://t.co/EgOligNiG0

From Afghanistan to Yemen, from Syria to northern Ethiopia, armed conflict, violence and insecurity took a devastating toll on children throughout 2021.

@UNICEF says every effort should be made to keep these children safe from harm. https://t.co/uFsn62sAVE

#HappyNewYear from the UN Social Media team! 

Wishing all our followers a happy, healthy and peaceful 2022. 🕊 https://t.co/6r9XlrxrXS

"Together, let’s make recovery our resolution for 2022. 

For people, planet and prosperity." 

-- @antonioguterres shares a message of hope for the #NewYear. https://t.co/NP2jgkDDHx

Biking to work 🚲
Switching off lights 💡
Reducing food waste 🚮
& more!

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 

Chat with us over Facebook Messenger for more ideas on how YOU can #ActNow & help make this a decade of #ClimateAction: https://t.co/mezgw4BZ4q https://t.co/weacVvHQiP

Nurses
Doctors
Sanitation workers
Journalists
Truck drivers
Grocery store workers
Researchers
& all essential workers

As these everyday heroes continue their vital work, we thank them for all they have done for our communities throughout the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: Chiara Fiori https://t.co/ObtbDgg684

Out celebrating this #NewYearsEve? 

Drive safely. 🚗
Never drink and drive. 🛑 
Always wear your seat belt. ❌

More from @WHO on the risks of harmful use of alcohol. https://t.co/87WGblHfs3 https://t.co/SmXaizeZlH

1 in 3 women & girls experience violence in their lifetime -- and amid #COVID19, domestic abuse has surged worldwide.

Learn to recognize the signs of an abusive relationship and how you can help victims find safety and support. https://t.co/dmikJ2pbm5 via @UN_Women https://t.co/7Fj0cFZ84d

🏋🏽 Exercise regularly
🍛 Eat healthily
😴 Get enough sleep
🍺 Limit alcohol intake
🗣 Talk about your feelings

@WHO has more tips on how to improve your mental well-being: https://t.co/OnDy1sVm7E https://t.co/M68q609Pco

From the #COVID19 pandemic to the urgent need for #ClimateAction, the world is facing unprecedented crises in the year ahead. 

@UNDP explores what will be needed to address these challenges and more. https://t.co/kf1x1yP7Og https://t.co/BWcIRneBaJ

"Moments of great difficulty are also moments of great opportunity."

-- @antonioguterres in his #NewYear message. https://t.co/gQH7Aeex7f https://t.co/PIRZbg3gQ1

Without urgent action, @UNICEF says 1+ million children could die from severe malnutrition in Afghanistan next year.

As desperate families struggle to feed their children, they need more support than ever. 

You can help: https://t.co/eXfTvh8XwY

https://t.co/ew8t82G1Ip

The start of a new year is an opportunity for people to come together and pledge their support for keeping the promise of the #GlobalGoals. 

Tell us how you plan to make the world a better place in 2022! https://t.co/hKdCXOPbA2

From driving less to saving electricity, from reducing food waste to recycling, each of us can #ActNow for people & planet. 

Get inspired to make #ClimateAction your New Year's resolution!  https://t.co/mezgw4kocS https://t.co/5HXVpEjZVh

🛒 Buy only what you need
❄️ Freeze leftovers
🥧 Share the food you won’t eat with others

During this holiday season, we can all do our part to help #StopTheWaste. @WFP has more tips: https://t.co/8f4a2ODtO8 https://t.co/Ru4Cflks4H

As the number of people forced to flee their homes due to conflict, persecution & the climate crisis rose to record highs, read how the UN worked to help millions of displaced families around the world in 2021. https://t.co/LdNZD9A9K6

Gender equality is required to achieve all the #GlobalGoals and key to a better world!

As 2021 comes to a close, @UN_Women highlights some of the major moments for gender equality & women’s rights from the past year.
https://t.co/APIXj07uH0 #GenerationEquality

“This is the time to rise above short-term nationalism & protect populations & economies against future variants by ending global vaccine inequity.”

-- @WHO chief @DrTedros. https://t.co/oTHhTBCIs0 https://t.co/9BvPNs8ii1

The Trolls are helping the United Nations take #ClimateAction while improving nutrition around the world.

🍊🌽🫐🥕🍌🥦
 
Join the #TrollsFoodHeroes by wasting less food and eating more fruits & vegetables. https://t.co/dDZ0DeYPhW #ActNow #GlobalGoals https://t.co/SfzM72IvkD

"This is the most important battle of my life, and I will not give up."

At #COP26 in November, @antonioguterres discussed the urgent need for #ClimateAction with @UNICEF Youth Advocate and climate activist @nickibeckerok. https://t.co/3rvQ8jkkKH #YearInReview https://t.co/raMms3XwXx

"When we respect nature & our planet, we are respecting ourselves."

Listen to @UNEP chief @andersen_inger talk to @MelissaFleming about the power and importance of individual #ClimateAction on our Awake At Night podcast. https://t.co/q72SPKGNNv https://t.co/Hl4GUEarUz

The spread of misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.

❌ Don't share rumours.
✅ Choose content verified by reliable sources.

#PledgetoPause before sharing online. https://t.co/qFqoh7CZOA

🎨: @RBdandi https://t.co/5i6ZAEqaI7

There's no denying it: 
We need to #ActNow to address the climate crisis. 

This year, young #ClimateAction leaders from across the world have explained how we can all make a difference in our daily lives in this new podcast: https://t.co/74jPSLpbV3 #YearInReview https://t.co/fHm3JMtcaU

From speaking up and engaging in constructive discussions to volunteering in support of vulnerable groups, we can all do our part to #FightRacism & all forms of discrimination. 

More ways to take action: https://t.co/PWxqEMAxTC https://t.co/n4jOwKppqx

"Together, let’s make recovery our resolution for 2022. 
For people, planet and prosperity." 

-- @antonioguterres in his #NewYear message. https://t.co/WjLlcPc7ui

Yemen: “Any targeting of civilians & civilian objects as well as indiscriminate attacks by any actor is a flagrant violation of international humanitarian law and must stop immediately."

-- UN Special Envoy @OSE_Yemen Hans Grundberg https://t.co/UVxbwLZQig

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for our future.

The length of droughts, the spread of diseases & more hinge on these few degrees.

Limiting temperature rise is still possible if we #ActNow. https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y via @UNFCCC https://t.co/8edp2nUQLJ
From Afghanistan to Ethiopia, Myanmar, Syria, Yemen and beyond, see how the UN has been working to protect people caught up in conflict and instability this year. https://t.co/dznwEFZMVF

Depression can happen to anybody.

It is an illness, not a character weakness - and it can be treated.

Get advice on how to help those who may be suffering from depression this holiday season: https://t.co/wVrUnSBw6j #LetsTalk https://t.co/rW60IIq7xk

#YearInReview: In November, climate activists & influencers joined world leaders at the UN climate conference #COP26 in Glasgow to demand urgent #ClimateAction. 

Get ideas for how you can #ActNow to help protect our planet: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/HHX0cYSsAA

#YearInReview: In 2021, our UNHCR colleagues continued to work on the frontlines of emergencies & crises in 135 countries.

See the moments that stood out, and ones that renew hope for a brighter future from @refugees:
https://t.co/wHx8vXZ79J

It costs less than $1 to feed a child for a day.  

During this holiday season, see how you can help achieve #ZeroHunger with @WFP's Share The Meal app: https://t.co/q2ILhuDETF https://t.co/vET8AwGX0r

🌄727 biosphere reserves in
🌎131 countries

@UNESCO's Biosphere Programme, which integrates nature conservation & sustainable development, promoting a long-lasting connection between people & nature, turned 50 on Monday. 
https://t.co/yCBIeUFpBA

"The people of Myanmar have already suffered tremendously."

UN Special Envoy Noeleen Heyzer appeals for New Year’s ceasefire throughout the country. https://t.co/JMrk3MlsKj

#COVID19 has shown the importance of strengthening epidemic prevention to avoid global health crises.

Monday is the International Day of Epidemic Preparedness.
https://t.co/bRoA19OJlG

50,000 bee flights are needed to produce 1kg of honey. 🍯

🐝 Learn more about these tiny #FoodHeroes from @FAO. https://t.co/oBcUDi7kAe

 https://t.co/umtD0Ho0oi

Major infectious diseases & epidemics have devastating impacts on people's lives everywhere.

To avoid future pandemics, we need to focus on prevention. 

More on Monday's International Day of Epidemic Preparedness: https://t.co/bRoA1a6kde https://t.co/a0H1AhHFAo

Cultural & creative industries are a powerful economic sector, strengthened by digitalization & a surge in services during the #COVID19 pandemic.

More from @UNCTAD as the International Year of Creative Economy for Sustainable Development comes to an end: https://t.co/A55yxIEpgt https://t.co/qqxd7Qa7wd

Ending the #COVID19 crisis and building a safer, healthier future will require investing in health systems that protect all people, everywhere. 

More on Monday's International Day of Epidemic Preparedness: https://t.co/bRoA1a6kde https://t.co/9cnBIuH5Hi

"An outbreak anywhere is a potential pandemic everywhere."

-- @antonioguterres stressed the need for global solidarity to prevent future health crises on Monday's International Day of Epidemic Preparedness. https://t.co/bRoA19OJlG https://t.co/x1gLRjnvkL

The UN's emergency response fund helps ensure fast and flexible funding is available to people in need -- anytime & anywhere. 

See how @UNCERF helped save lives in 2021. ⬇️ https://t.co/fNCUIlaInW

The start of a new year is an opportunity for people to come together and pledge their support for keeping the promise of the #GlobalGoals. 

Tell us how you plan to make the world a better place in 2022! https://t.co/jtD3sXvpK7 https://t.co/exsDzeFJ95

We can no longer ignore the climate crisis. 

It's time to stop making excuses & start making changes!

Let's take #ClimateAction before it’s too late: https://t.co/UaBpA9dm2V
via @UNDP

#DontChooseExtinction https://t.co/CTXsiC3hmI

A peaceful and inclusive society is the foundation of sustainable development.

We must work together to reduce violence, deliver justice, combat corruption, and ensure inclusive participation at all levels. https://t.co/xhDC9tQEd6 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/X50Ba2tBQW

Without urgent action, many families face a dire & uncertain future in Afghanistan. 

@UNICEF has launched its largest ever single-country appeal to respond to the needs of more than 24 million people in the country, half of whom are children. https://t.co/k516sbN72v

The #GlobalGoals have the power to create a better world by 2030. 🌍

See how @WFP is working to achieve #ZeroHunger by helping 800+ million people in need. https://t.co/q9xha3PDDT https://t.co/pRbhtVKKHJ

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, war or disaster at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/XiWUtN4Tf4 via @Refugees https://t.co/x82B4phRnG

"I don't like the word tolerance. Tolerance means I am superior to you. I don't want to be tolerated. I want mutual respect and understanding."

-- Rabbi Arthur Schneier, a Holocaust survivor & human rights activist, on Awake At Night this past year. https://t.co/l5R4CQsPUn https://t.co/f12qZmlnzX

The difference between 1.5°C & 3°C global warming means vastly different scenarios for the future. 

Our survival on this planet hinges on these few degrees.

Addressing the climate crisis & limiting temperature rise is possible if we #ActNow. https://t.co/dDZ0DeYPhW via @UNFCCC https://t.co/URs4W9XssT
From our UN family, to yours -- wishing everyone warmest seasons greetings and hoping all who celebrate have a happy and safe #Christmas! https://t.co/AKQped415V

Health heroes have been key in the fight against #COVID19.

As the International Year of Health & Care Workers comes to an end, we are reminded that they must be supported, protected & equipped to deliver safe health care at all times. https://t.co/BQT2JvSp6r https://t.co/7VOdLjB5nh

Millions of tonnes of food are wasted every year and the majority of this food loss takes places in households.

Millions of tonnes of food are wasted every year and the majority of this food loss takes place in https://t.co/NN7wlEHhPQ your home. https://t.co/HBKSXogDQW https://t.co/Mc6wma8gcu

Never give up.
Never retreat. 
Keep pushing forward. 

I am with you.

-- @antonioguterres had a message for young people, indigenous communities, women leaders & all those inspiring #ClimateAction at this year's #COP26. 

Here's how you can #ActNow. https://t.co/UfRMNsZ40Q https://t.co/KyKplakdIA
🎄 #MerryChristmas to all who are celebrating! https://t.co/OAE1jOK5mI

As people around the world grapple with another crippling wave of #COVID19, @WHO is stressing the urgent need to ensure people everywhere have access to lifesaving vaccines. 

Learn why #VaccinesWork and their vital role in ending the pandemic. https://t.co/MPbsAKAf0V https://t.co/qdabIr069G

In 2021, only one woman was awarded the @NobelPrize. 

@UN_Women works to create a more gender-equal world by eliminating structural barriers that hold women back. https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB https://t.co/X9ylmtGabN

🍎🍊🥦 Fruits & vegetables are dietary essentials.

Ensuring everyone has access to them is crucial for achieving food security & combatting malnutrition.

More from @FAO as the Int’l Year of Fruits & Vegetables comes to an end: https://t.co/Q8jZMHW4lI #IYFV2021 https://t.co/I4hSZDp8K5

Media has a fundamental role to play to stop rape culture.

All of us can also help by changing the narrative that places blame on victims and by using the power of language in service of survivors, not perpetrators. 

More from @UN_Women: https://t.co/TELjf71enH https://t.co/mzjHtDqoL8

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, a small share can have big consequences.

We can all take steps to verify facts before sharing something online. 

#PledgeToPause & help stop the spread of harmful misinformation. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/TcyWq6X3SI

Technology has been an essential lifeline for keeping people connected during #COVID19. 

Yet, not all have benefited equally.

Reducing the digital divide is key to ensuring people everywhere have equal opportunities. https://t.co/kf1x1yxwWI via @UNDP https://t.co/OohvvSYNsh

Your everyday choices can help tackle the climate crisis: 

Biking to work 🚴‍♀️
Switching off lights 💡
Buying sustainable fashion  👖
& more!

Chat with us over Facebook @Messenger to get more tips on how you can #ActNow to take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/mezgw4BZ4q https://t.co/rccXQdkegC

Racism, discrimination and intolerance undermine the fabric of our societies and affect us all. 

Learn how hate and stigmatization particularly impact vulnerable communities and what we can all do to #FightRacism: https://t.co/taxP3miHAy https://t.co/nuSEDSJ0YN

"We must all do everything we can to preserve the life, dignity & future of all Afghans."

-- @UNReliefChief as Security Council adopts resolution clearing the way for humanitarian aid to reach people in dire need of assistance in Afghanistan. https://t.co/bO5WWHl4tz

➡️Humanity
➡️Neutrality
➡️Impartiality
➡️Independence

From natural disasters to armed conflict, @WFP remains committed to these four humanitarian principles while providing life-saving assistance to people around the world. https://t.co/RPWWkYJNUt
https://t.co/w6LFigO2NJ

Once a novelty, plastic shopping bags are now found in every corner of the world and produced at a rate of up to one trillion bags per year, 

@UNEP explains how plastic bags intensify some of the most serious environmental challenges of our lifetimes. https://t.co/0qgDQeYIDf

Being displaced from home during the cold winter months can put refugee families’ lives at risk. 

Your support can keep them safe and warm. https://t.co/Oh09UmcVXy via @Refugees https://t.co/BCFgIDh1s3

Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it: #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation — and the virus. https://t.co/q5ZFkRwXkH https://t.co/9A1BsyMHyG

Throughout 2021, the women & men of the United Nations worked to find solutions to some of the biggest problems facing humanity. 

@UN_Photo captured images of our efforts from around the world. https://t.co/otrSlMyVJj https://t.co/FhqbMJnstL

Yemen: @WFP says it's running out of funds to continue providing food assistance to 13 million people in the country.

Starting next month, families will receive reduced daily rations and without new funding, more severe cuts may be unavoidable. https://t.co/tX1vlZB468

From #ClimateAction to #COVID19 to gender equality, world leaders focused on some of the biggest challenges facing humanity during this year's #UNGA.

Solidarity & international cooperation will be key for addressing these issues & more in the year ahead. https://t.co/VYgBz2HMN9 https://t.co/olhRJQeZV6

To help safeguard the rights, health and lives of women and girls, @UNFPA says $835 million is needed to provide services and protection to those in need. 

More: https://t.co/qIc3S9Sch1 #InvestInHumanity https://t.co/JPc553GGBx

“Last year alone, 30 million people were displaced from climate and extreme weather events.”

-- UN #ClimateAction Adviser @SelwinHart shares his concerns about the climate emergency & its long-term effects on the most vulnerable on Awake At Night. https://t.co/it3LJtU9Sl https://t.co/03EvH75DzO

Information is key for ending racism & discrimination and to do our part to #StandUp4HumanRights.

Challenge yourself and #FightRacism with knowledge: https://t.co/zBExYaahGO https://t.co/Y7tUdg934w

Over this past year, world leaders, influencers, advocates & others around the world came together and pledged their support to keep the promise of the #GlobalGoals.

Join them! https://t.co/hKdCXOPbA2 #YearInReview https://t.co/2PCdn4w2XO

Free and fair parliamentary elections in 2022 will be an essential opportunity for the people of Lebanon to make their voices heard.

-- @antonioguterres as he concludes his visit to the country. https://t.co/fGoTqhxJls

As the migrant crisis on the Belarus-Poland border continues, @UNHumanRights is calling on both countries to address the situation in line with their obligations under international law. 

https://t.co/IwAz8dBdUJ

The impacts of the climate crisis are all around us. 

Check out our fast facts about #ClimateAction to learn more about how how it affects: 
👷‍♂️jobs
🥕food
👩‍⚕️health
📈economy 
⚡️energy
💰finance 
and more: https://t.co/4l65ngfIzP https://t.co/tI1O1JJSbr

"Is this how our story is due to end?" asked Sir David Attenborough in November at #COP26, calling all of us to help turn the tragedy of the climate crisis into triumph. 

Here is how you can take #ClimateAction: https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y 

#YearInReview https://t.co/Lrej0Y648g

The start of a new year is an opportunity to reflect on how to show solidarity &  lend support to others.

Here are some ideas about how YOU can help refugees around the world: https://t.co/oGHqG9RV4B https://t.co/F9FfKdCeAk

This holiday season, the Christmas tree display in Rome includes special #GlobalGoals gift packages.

From #ZeroHunger to #ClimateAction, we can all #ActNow to build a better future. https://t.co/iXLgyQIFcS via @FAO https://t.co/wLx6edVdDf

Children around the 🌍 continue to be affected by conflict, the climate crisis and #COVID19. 

With your help, @UNICEF will work to support 177 million children in 145 countries and territories in the coming year. https://t.co/bcfYr5syqK

Somalia: Decades of conflict, climate shocks and disease outbreaks have left 7.7 million people in need of humanitarian assistance in 2022.

"We have no time to lose,” said @UNReliefChief, in an appeal for $1.5 billion to support those in need. https://t.co/YP4GRY96uc

"I was deeply moved by the stories & insights shared by refugee students & parents."

In Lebanon, @antonioguterres met with Palestine students at an @UNRWA school & also paid tribute to those affected by last year's devastating blast in Beirut. https://t.co/OLDj9GTmNI https://t.co/M5pEaqX902

"Now is the time to explore whether a political process in Syria can meaningfully move forward in 2022." 

-- @UNEnvoySyria says a solution to the conflict is possible, if all sides commit to working together. https://t.co/eWnz9zcnq5

No matter what someone looks like or where they are from, we all share a longing to belong, to care for our loved ones & to be connected with our communities.

On Monday's #SolidarityDay, we can all stand up for the rights of migrants. https://t.co/8FfKX2zl5K via @UNHumanRights https://t.co/BBrUZ1Rq6M

"Political leaders do not have the right to be divided & paralyze the country."

In Lebanon, @antonioguterres said the best ways to support the country's people is to overcome the economic & financial crisis & promote peace, stability & development. https://t.co/1p7M58A90S https://t.co/cvsxihgi3V

As #COVID19 continues to spread, we can all take steps to protect ourselves & loved ones.

@UNICEF has tips on how to keep yourself & others safe this holiday season. https://t.co/RMYnXpERVB

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. 

People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

Join them on Monday's #SolidarityDay! https://t.co/qCGnLuBtI5

🎨: @megatoeDesign https://t.co/mBxVMLYbj6

The UN has been deploying police officers to peace operations around the world since 1960.

@UNPOL officers #ServingForPeace are helping to advance the political, development & humanitarian objectives of the UN, including the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/RpNlF3NN1I https://t.co/MnkXFvcl6r

The #GlobalGoals are our blueprint to achieve a better & more sustainable future for all. Making them a reality requires global cooperation & solidarity.

On Monday's #SolidarityDay & every day, take action for a better world! https://t.co/Ss4uMcFBOl https://t.co/ajckePvlcD
